trial_1.summarized_frq:
The patient's symptoms are consistent with a possible diagnosis of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) such as Crohn's disease or ulcerative colitis. The presence of severe cramping on the left side of the belly, bloody stool, and an urgent need to use the bathroom are common symptoms of IBD. A decreased appetite may also be a symptom of IBD. 
To confirm the diagnosis, a biopsy of the affected area may be performed to look for signs of inflammation or damage to the lining of the intestines. Blood tests may also be done to check for markers of inflammation or infection. Additionally, imaging tests such as an MRI or CT scan may be used to assess the extent of the damage to the intestines.
